greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of an n-set having k cycles of size > 1 (0<=k<=floor(n/2)).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
Jean-Luc Baril and Sergey Kirgizov, Transformation à la Foata for special kinds of descents and excedances, arXiv:2101.01928 [math.CO], 2021. See Theorem 2. p. 5.
FindStat - Combinatorial Statistic Finder, The number of nontrivial cycles of a permutation pi in its cycle decomposition
formula: E.g.f.: exp(x*(1-y))/(1-x)^y. Binomial transform of triangle A008306. exp(x)*((-x-log(1-x))^k)/k! is e.g.f. of k-th column.
maple: egf:= proc(k::nonnegint) option remember; x-> exp(x)* ((-x-ln(1-x))^k)/k! end; T:= (n,k)-> coeff(series(egf(k)(x), x=0, n+1), x, n) *n!; seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..n/2), n=0..30); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 14 2008
b:= proc(n) option remember; expand(`if`(n=0, 1, add(b(n-i)*
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n)):
T:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(k<0 or k>2*n, 0,
seq(seq(T(n,k), k=0..n/2), n=0..15);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 16 2017
mathematica: max = 12; egf = Exp[x*(1-y)]/(1-x)^y; s = Series[egf, {x, 0, max}, {y, 0, max}] // Normal; t[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[s, {x, 0, n}, {y, 0, k}]*n!; t[0, 0] = t[1, 0] = 1; Table[t[n, k], {n, 0, max}, {k, 0, n/2}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 28 2014 *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 03 2008
